thread.title: UMass Lowell’s Kevin Boyle earns Hockey East weekly honors
thread.title_full: UMass Lowell’s Kevin Boyle earns Hockey East weekly honors

author: Justin Soderberg
title: UMass Lowell’s Kevin Boyle earns Hockey East weekly honors
text:
Tweet on Twitter Kevin Boyle named HEA Defensive Player of the Week. (Photo/John Corneau/Mill City Sports) 
UMass Lowell River Hawks senior goaltender Kevin Boyle was named this week’s Hockey East Defensive Player of the Week, the league announced Monday. 
Boyle started both games as UMass Lowell defeated the Colorado College Tigers in a two-game series at the Tsongas Center in Lowell, Massachusetts this weekend. The senior net-minder stopped 39-of-42 shots and picked up two wins over the two game span. 
The Manalapan, New Jersey native stopped 23 shots on Friday night as UMass Lowell defeated Colorado College, 3-2, and had another 16 saves during Saturday night’s , 2-1, win over the Tigers. 
RELATED: UMass Lowell downs Colorado College, completes sweep 
The 23-year-old owns a 3-0-0 record with a 1.00 goals-against average, .957 save percentage and a shutout to start the season. Last year, the Massachusetts Minutemen transfer posted a 18-9-6 record with 2.42 GAA, .915 save percentage and three shutouts over 34 games. 
Boyle and his River Hawks will open up a two-game home-and-home series with the Merrimack College Warriors this Friday, October 23 at Lawler Arena in North Andover, Massachusetts. 
Hockey East also announced Dennis Kravchenko (Massachusetts) was named Warrior Player of the Week and Colin White (Boston College) picked up Pro Ambitions Rookie of the Week honors.
